title: What are the comparisons of Plato and Socrates? - Quora

response.answer_text: Good question - and like a lot of good questions it doesn’t have a good answer. First problem: Did Socrates actually exist? It looks like Socrates may of been just a character for Plato’s mouthpiece. Second problem: We only really know of Socrates through Plato’s writing and Plato didn’t mark those dialogues where he was reporting Socrates and where he was doing his own philosophy. A simplified answer for you which ignores these to problems follows. Socrates used a methodology involving questions and answers - a technique which would leave his questioned person confused. Plato made large reference to a second world of which those things we know of “Partake” or “Reflect” the properties of that world (e.g. Something is truthful if and only if is reflects the other world “truth”). This other world is known as “the world of forms”.
